Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery light chalice; greyish-white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; added white tendrils and dotted concentric circles with added red centres, above band of faded white zigzag between lines; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bearded warrior to left (head with very pale brown skin, white on eye, dark brown beard and hair, with shield decorated with rosette as device); above on left, possibly shafts of two spears with painted inscription to their right.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Grey-Slip Group. The sherds in this group have a characteristically grey coloured slip. The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.354.
The text is enigmatic, but Wachter's reading as a possible dedication to the gods (of the Hellenes) has little to recommend it (Non-Attic Vase Inscriptions, 215, N(a) and 217).
